metadata.title: CVE-2020-12415 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When "%2F" was present in a manifest URL, Firefox's AppCache behavior mayhave become confused and allowed a manifest to be served from asubdirectory. This could cause the appcache to be used to service requestsfor the top level directory. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 78.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12415` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
